sections.comments: ARTH 332 is equivalent to CLST 332. If this course is full, students can register in the equivalent section. CLST 332 will apply towards Art History and Visual Art program requirements in the same way as ARTH 332. Please contact the AHVA undergraduate advisor with any questions: greg.gibson@ubc.ca.The social, cultural, political, and visual history of Roman art from the eighth century BCE to the fourth century CE. Topics include the power of images to shape society; identity construction; cultural exchanges and borrowings across the ancient world; the impact of the Roman Empire on local visual traditions; and the complex relationships between subject and representation.

description: Visual culture of the ancient Roman world from the 8th century BCE to the 4th century CE.
